audioInterruptionTips: When the "speech interruption" mode is enabled, it allows users to interrupt the model while it is speaking. The model will immediately terminate the previous round of generation and respond to the user's latest question.
videoQualityTips: When the "high resulation" mode is enabled, the model will perform high resolution encoding on the last frame, allowing the model to see more detailed parts.
vadThresholdTips: The VAD threshold indicates how long the sound needs to be silent before triggering inference. If the VAD threshold is too low, it may trigger accidentally during speech pauses, while if it's too high, it will result in slower initial response.
assistantPromptTips: Model task instructions are used to support different task objectives, you can create new timbre by modify task instructions.
toneColorOptionsTips: We have provided a selection of sample timbres, and you also have the option to choose "null" and instruct the model to create a new timbre.
q1: Q1: How long is the initial delay of the model?
a1: A1: Regardless of network delay, it is about 2.5-3 seconds (from the end of user speech query to the beginning of model speech display), and 2s is the common initial delay commercially available for the omni model. We currently provide a simple demo for the open-source community to try on, and will continue to accelerate model inference.
q2: Q2: Why does the initial delay in the demo feel longer than 3 seconds?
a2: A2: The initial delay in voice conversation and live streaming demos is significantly influenced by the network connection between the browser and the server. For a smoother user experience, we recommend hosting the demo on local servers. E.g., a 4090 server will work well.
q3: Q3: Is the audio quality of the model's inference result the same as the web demo?
a3: A3: The replay of the overall generated speech will offer better quality than the streaming speech output. Network delays can cause pauses in responses.
answerUnsafe: Sorry, this question is temporarily unavailable. Please try another one.

hdModeTips: Input 1280x720 HD frames to the model.
